name: Silver net and fish treefree journal
description:
This book is part of my "treefree" line, which uses over 90% recycled and plant-based materials.

This eco-friendly journal features silkscreened silver fish in a waving silver net on black Lokta paper. The design is inspired by Mithila art in Nepal. The Lokta paper is handmade from the long fibers of Nepal's paper plant, Daphne cannabina. Lokta paper is completely natural, acid-free, and tree-free. I have sealed the covers with a protective archival varnish.

Endpapers are a distressed, sketchy gray which provides a textured contrast to the cover. Contains 84 pages (168 sides) of 100% recycled 24 lb NewLeaf paper. The paper is slightly flecked with fibers.

Coptic binding is an ancient Egyptian bookbinding technique which allows the book to lie completely flat, which is ideal for sketching and journaling.

5 by 7.5 inches. Acid-free materials and archival quality. All environmentally sustainable papers.

name: Lime yellow and gray colorblock journal
description:
For the down to earth person who still has her head in the sky...

This journal features rich and earthy colorblocks of lime yellow and slate grey. The cover paper is made in Thailand with a mix of kozo and banana (like the fruit), and full of wooden particles and fibers, for a rich organic texture. That also means it's extremely eco-friendly because no trees were harmed in the making, as it is plant-based.

Inside endpapers are a beautiful turquoise in a vintage fleur de lis pattern. Contains 80 leaves of Strathmore 25% cotton writing paper.

Coptic binding is an ancient Egyptian bookbinding technique which allows the book to lie completely flat, which is ideal for sketching and journaling.

5 by 7.5 inches. Acid-free materials and archival quality.

name: Asian Argyle Large Journal
description:
Stately yet slightly preppy... Asian Argyle?!?

This journal features a modern red diamond pattern with gold-leaf tracing. The chiyogami (also known as yuzen or washi) paper is a high-quality silkscreened Japanese paper that is "warming" to the touch. The Japanese treasure this paper and use it to cover boxes, for stationary, or framed on the wall as artwork.

Use it as a journal, photo album, or sketchbook extraordinary. Give it as a lasting, thoughtful gift to a sensibly quirky friend.

Contains 224 sides (112 pages) of premium, 100% post-consumer content NewLeaf paper. 

Coptic binding is an ancient Egyptian bookbinding technique which allows the book to lie completely flat, which is ideal for sketching and journaling.

This is the large version of my normal journals, 9 by 6 inches. Acid-free materials and archival quality.

name: Red and black treefree journal
description:
This book is part of my "treefree" line, which uses over 90% recycled and plant-based materials.

This eco-friendly journal has two sides to fit your fancy. Side one features a sketchy gold pattern silkscreened on a brilliant red handmade Lokta paper. The other side is covered in an organic, textured black banana paper. The Lokta paper is handmade from the long fibers of a Nepalese plant. Both cover papers are completely natural, acid-free, and tree-free. I have sealed the covers with a protective archival varnish.

Endpapers are a distressed gray. 168 sides (84 pages) of 100% recycled 24 lb NewLeaf paper. The paper is slightly flecked with fibers.

Coptic binding is an ancient Egyptian bookbinding technique which allows the book to lie completely flat, which is ideal for sketching and journaling. 

5 by 7.5 inches. Acid-free materials and archival quality. All environmentally sustainable papers.

name: Nubbly farmhouse journal
description:
I've covered this cozy journal with a nubbly oatmeal bookcloth. Textured and organic, delicate yet sturdy. 

Endpapers are a distressed, plummy floral which a provides great vintage highlight and matches the binding thread. 168 sides (84 pages) of 100% recycled 24 lb NewLeaf paper. The paper is slightly flecked with fibers.

Coptic binding allows the book to lie completely flat, which is ideal for sketching and journaling. 

5 by 7.5 inches. Acid-free materials and archival quality. All environmentally sustainable papers.
